page.title: 20EARLY HISTORY OF THE AREA.
page.content: With the exception of the{BATTLE OF {MORFA RHUDDLAN}in 795 AD (which itself is not totally accepted as an historical certainty) the area does not have as rich a history as compared with its immediate surroundings.The presence of an exapnse of marshland the size of Morfa Rhuddlan detered the {ROMANS}from building a road .The{ {NORMANS,}who considered that Wales began at the River Conwy and regarded the remainder of North East wales to be part of England,did not survey the area in the original Domesday Book.The early {WELSH PRINCES}paid little heed either to the area,which they called{ {RHUFONIOG.}RHUDDLAN CASTLE,built by Edward 1 was not linked to the area either by any major road.
